questions.text: A 26-Year-old woman in the first trimester of pregnancy has been admitted with retching and repeated vomiting with large hematemesis. Her pulse rate is 126/minute, and her blood pressure is 80 mm Hg systolic. The most likely diagnosis is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Mallory-Weiss syndrome Upper gastrointestinal bleeding: Occasionally, persistent vomiting may be accompanied by worrisome upper gastrointestinal bleeding . The obvious concern is bleeding peptic ulceration; however, most women have slight linear mucosal tears near the gastroesophageal junction. Women with these co-called Mallory-Weiss tears usually respond promptly to conservative measures. With persistent retching lrss is common but more serious side effect develops BOERHAAVE SYNDROME may develop.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option:B. Bleeding from esophageal varices is incorrect option . Option:C. Peptic ulcer is incorrect option Option:D. Hiatus hernia is incorrect option

questions.text: A 28-Year-old woman presents with amenorrhea since 3 months, pain abdomen and vaginal bleeding since 2 weeks. On examination abdominal tenderness is present, in the absence of other signs. Investigations show a positive UPT. The patient is diagnosed as unruptured ectopic pregnancy and further investigations are performed in order to plan her treatment. The presence of the following would prompt you to do medical management except:
questions.correct_answer: D. TVS showing fetal cardiac activity
questions.explanation:
Solution:

TVS showing fetal cardiac activity TVS showing fetal cardiac activity is an indication of surgical management by laparoscopy or microsurgical laparotomy, hence the answer.

Highyeild:

Type all highlighted in highyeild box . Medical management of unruptured ectopic pregnancy is considered when The patient is hemodynamically stable Serum beta hcg is < 3000IU/L Tubal diameter is < 4cm No fetal cardiac activity There is no intra-abdominal hemorrhage The drugs used for Medical management are: 1.Direct local therapy (laparoscopy or USG guided) Methotrexate, KCl, Prostaglandin hyperosmolar glucose or actinomycin. 2.systemic therapy -single dose of methotrexate 50 mg/m2 IM. Follow up after medical management is done by measuring the serial decline in Beta hCG. βhCG Fall >50% If fall <10% - one more dose max m dose)

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option:A. Serum Beta hCG 2000IU/L is one of the indication for medical management Option:B. Patient hemodynamically stable is one of the indication for medical management Option:C. Gestation sac size 2.5cm is one of the indication for medical management.

questions.text: A 28-Year-old female with 11 weeks of amenorrhea presents to OBG Opd for ANC. She says her urine pregnancy test done at home showed positive. On examination, P-90/min, saturation normal, pallor +, afebrile, RR-14/min, BP-128/88mmHg. She was advised routine lab investigations and usg. Her lab investigations were normal but her usg showed no signs of pregnancy. UPT was repeated twice and was negative both the times. She could be a case of-
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Pseudocyesis Pseudocyesis (Syn: Phantom, spurious, false pregnancy): It is a psychological disorder where the woman has the false but firm belie f that she is pregnant although no pregnancy exists. The woman often is infertile who has an intense desire to have a baby . The conspicuous feature is the cessation of menstruation. Other confusing manifestations are gradual enlargement of the abdomen because of deposition of fat, secretion from the breasts and intestinal movement, imagining it to be fetal movement. In some cases, the condition continues until eventually spurious labor sets in. Obstetric examination reveals absence of positive signs of pregnancy. Examination with ultrasound and/or immunological tests for pregnancy may be required to negate the diagnosis.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option A. Fibroid: (1) The tumor is slow growing, often takes years (2) Amenorrhea is absent (3) The feel is firm, more towards hard but may be cystic in cystic degeneration (4) Positive signs of pregnancy are absent (5) Ultrasonography or immunological test for pregnancy gives negative result . Option C. Cystic ovarian tumor: The diagnostic points are: (1) The swelling is slow growing, usually takes months to grow (2) Amenorrhea is usually absent (3) It feels cystic or tense cystic (4) Absence of Braxton-Hicks contraction (5) Absence of positive signs of pregnancy (6) Ultrasonography shows absence of fetus. Option D. Encysted peritonitis: (1) History of Koch’s infection (2) Amenorrhea of longer duration may be present (3) Swelling is ill defined (4) Absence of positive signs of pregnancy (5) Internal examination reveals normal uterus separated from the swelling (6) Ultrasonography — absence of fetus.

questions.text: A couple married for 6 yrs and unable to conceive visited the infertility clinic. They had no comorbidities. Examination of both the partners was done to find the cause of infertility. Her LMP was before 8 weeks. While performing a usg on the female partner the finding was as shown in the image below. The following finding could be found in which week of pregnancy:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

5 weeks The given image depicts a gestational sac which could be identified as early as 5 weeks. ULTRASONOGRAPHY: Intradecidual gestational sac (GS) is identified as early as 29 to 35 days of gestation. Fetal viability and gestational age is determined by detecting the following structures by transvaginal ultrasonography . Gestational sac and yolk sac by 5 menstrual weeks ; Fetal pole and cardiac activity — 6 weeks ; Embryonic movements by 7 weeks. Fetal gestational age is best determined by measuring the CRL between 7 and 12 weeks (variation ± 5 days). The gestational sac (true) must be differentiated from pseudogestational sac

Highyeild:

Mean sac diameter = Length + height + width 3 1. Gest. Age = MSD (mm) + 30 days MSD > 25 mm & CRL > 7 mm, But no cardiac activity → missed abortion. 2. Nuchal Translucency Scan (NT Scan) NT scan = 11 to 13 weeks CRL 45-84 mm →SIC translucent area between skin & soft tissue overlying the fetal spine → 2mp marker for aneuploidies NT <3 mm-Normal > 3 mm abnormal Suggest down's syndrome > Turner Synd > cardiac - anomalies. 3. 2nd Trimester scan- Aka:: Anomaly scan / Level II scan OR TIFFA Scan {Targeted Imaging for Fetal anomalies } 18 to 22 weeks 4. 3 rd Trimester Scan Interval scan | Growth scan Fetal nutrition → by Abd. Circumference. Q Sequence of Imaging → dating scan > NT scan > TIFFA Scan> Interval / Growth scan

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option:A. 4 weeks is incorrect option . Option:C. 7 weeks is incorrect option . Option:D. 12 weeks is incorrect option .

Extraedge:

Features on USG True gestational sac Pseudo gestational sac • Location within the uterus • Shape • Double ring sign due to chorion • Identification of structures: yolk sac, fetal pole • Increase in sac size Eccentric Round and regular in office Present Present 1 mm/day Central. Irregular Absent Absent Absent

questions.text: Early date for detection of fetal heart:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

6.0-6.5 weeks Embryonic investigations suggest that cardiac contractions begin in fetus at 36 days gestational age. For practical purposes, many sinologists consider the identification of cardiac activity in an embryo with a CRL of less than 5 mm as 6 weeks GA . Cardiac activity should be detected routinely when the embryo attains a length of 4 to 5 mm . This corresponds to a GA of 0 to 6.5 weeks, at which time the MSD is 13 to 18 mm. Using a transabdominal approach , cardiac activity should be evident by 7- 8 weeks GA, when the MSD is 25 mm .

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option:B. 6.5-7 weeks is incorrect option Option:C. 7.1-7.5 weeks is incorrect option Option:D. 8 weeks is incorrect option

questions.text: Match the following signs of pregnancy accordingly:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1 =b, 2=a, 3=d, 4=c Jacquemier’s or Chadwick’s sign : It is the dusky hue of the vestibule and anterior vaginal wall visible at about 8th week of pregnancy. The discoloration is due to local vascular congestion . Vaginal sign:Osiander’s sign: (a) Apart from the bluish discoloration of the anterior vaginal wal l(b) The walls become softened and (c) Copious non-irritating mucoid discharge appears at 6th week (d) There is increased pulsation, felt through the lateral fornices at 8th wee k called Osiander’s sign . Cervical signs: Goodell’s sign : Cervix becomes soft a s early as 6th week , a little earlier in multiparous. The pregnant cervix feels like the lips of the mouth , while in the non-pregnant state, like that of the tip of the nose. On speculum examination, the bluish discoloration of the cervix is visible. It is due to increased vascularity. Palmer’s sign: Regular and rhythmic uterine contraction can be elicited during bimanual examination as early as 4–8 weeks. Palmer in 1949, first described it and it is a valuable sign when elicited.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option:B . 1=a, 2=b , 3=c, 4=d is incorrect option Option:C . 1=c, 2=a , 3=b, 4=d is incorrect option Option:D. 1=d, 2=c , 3=b, 4=a is incorrect option

questions.text: Pseudo gestational sac seen in ultrasonography of:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Ectopic gestation When ultrasound examination reveals a sac without an embryo or yolk sac, the diagnosis is limited to one of three entities: A normal early intrauterine pregnancy (IUP). An abnormal intrauterine pregnancy (IUP). A pseudo gestational sac in a patient with an ectopic pregnancy

Highyeild:

In advanced ectopics, decidual sloughing with resultant intracavitary fluid or blood may create a so-called “ pseudogestational sac ”, a small and irregular structure that may be confused with an intrauterine gestation. In such a case - true and pseudogestational sac can be differentiated. Features on USG True gestational sac Pseudo gestational sac • Location within the uterus • Shape • Double ring sign due to chorion • Identification of structures: yolk sac, fetal pole • Increase in sac size Eccentric Round and regular in office Present Present 1 mm/day Central. Irregular Absent Absent Absent

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option:A. Missed abortion When the fetus is dead and retained inside the uterus for a variable period, it is known as Missed abortion will not show pseudogestational sac Option:C. Complete abortion Here the products of conception are expelled en masse .will not show pseudogestational sac Option:D. Hematometra is a collection or retention of blood in the uterus most commonly due to an imperforate hymen or transverse vaginal septum .is incorrect option .

questions.text: The following are related to uterine soufflé except:

options.label: A
options.text: It is a soft blowing systolic murmur heard on the sides of pregnant uterus

options.label: B
options.text: The sound is synchronous with the maternal pulse

options.label: C
options.text: It is due to increased blood flow through the umbilical arteries

options.label: D
options.text: It can be heard even in a big fibroid

questions.correct_answer: C. It is due to increased blood flow through the umbilical arteries
questions.explanation:
Solution:

It is due to increased blood flow through the umbilical arteries is not correct with respect to uterine soufflé. Uterine souffle is a soft blowing and systolic murmur heard low down at the sides of the uterus, best on the left side . The sound is synchronous with the maternal pulse and is due to increase in blood flow through the dilated uterine vessels. It can be heard in big uterine fibroid .

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option:A. It is a soft blowing systolic murmur heard on the sides of pregnant uterus is correct Option:B. The sound is synchronous with the maternal pulse is correct Option:D. It can be heard even in a big fibroid is correct

questions.text: Which one of the following congenital malformation of the fetus can be diagnosed in first trimester by ultrasound?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Anencephaly The fetal malformation, anencephaly can be diagnosed as early as 8-10 weeks/first trimester in experienced herds. Usg features of anencephaly are : mickey mouse sign Angiomatous brain tissue Absence of cranial vault

Highyeild:

Anencephaly : It is characterised by absence o f the cranial vault and cerebral hemispheres . It is the most common type of neural tube defect . Caused by failure of closure of Rostral Neuropore at an early embryonic stage. PATHOLOGICAL FEATURES: Forebrain and midbrain are absent. Cerebellum and Hindbrain are less involved or completely spared. Base of the skull and facial bones are not affected. Pituitary gland is either absent or hypoplastic. As a result: is diminished in size. Such fetuses have bulging eyes , short neck and a large tongue . mickey mouse sign Diagnosis By ultrasound: Demonstration of Absence of cranial vault and Angiomatous brain tissue Mickey mouse sign-seen in first trimester Time ≥14 weeks and accuracy-100% It can be diagnosed earliest by 10 weeks on ultrasound. Elevated levels of maternal serum alpha-fetoproteins. By amniocentesis: Purpose of amniocentesis is to measure concentration of alpha-fetoprotein (AFP) and acetylcholinesterase in amniotic fluid Amniotic fluid acetylcholinesterase has better diagnostic value than amniotic fluid AFP Q Most specific marker for diagnosis of encephaly-acetylcholinesterase. Management Termination of pregnancy irrespective of gestational age.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option:B. Iniencephaly is incorrect option. Iniencephaly: There is failure of formation of cervical and upper thoracic vertebrae and base of the skull with abnormally formed brain tissue. Option:C. Microcephaly Microcephaly: It has decreased head size. <-3SD In these patients both brain mass and total cell number are reduced. There is disproportion in size between the skull and face. It is difficult to recognize this anomaly by ultrasound – A head circumference below 2 SD from the mean is used as a diagnostic criteria in mid trimester scan Option:D. Holoprosencephaly Holoprosencephaly is the presence of a single centrally placed cerebral ventricle and may be associated with midline abnormalities of the face. With the use of vaginal probe it can be recognized in the beginning of mid trimester
